properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected Scenario^, or None if there is none.

properties.name: show_add_button
properties.doc: If False, the button to create a new scenario is not displayed.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc: If False, the cycles are not shown.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc: If False, the primary scenarios are not identified with specific visual hint.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when the value is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (Scenario^): the selected scenario.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the control.

properties.name: show_pins
properties.doc: If True, a pin is shown on each item of the selector and allows to restrict the number of displayed items.

properties.name: on_creation
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when a scenario is about to be created.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of this scenario selector.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • config (str): the name of the selected scenario configuration.
    • date (datetime): the creation date for the new scenario.
    • label (str): the user-specified label.
    • properties (dic): a dictionary containing all the user-defined custom properties.
  • The callback function can return a scenario, a string containing an error message (a scenario will not be created), or None (then a new scenario is created with the user parameters).

properties.name: show_dialog
properties.doc: If True, a dialog is shown when the user click on the 'Add scenario' button.

properties.name: scenarios
properties.doc: TODO: The list of Scenario^/Cycle^ to show. Shows all Cycle/Scenario if value is None.

properties.name: multiple
properties.doc: TODO: If True, the user can select multiple scenarios.

properties.name: filter
properties.doc: TODO: a list of Scenario^ attributes to filter on. If False, do not allow filter.

properties.name: show_search
properties.doc: TODO: If True, allows the user to search locally on label.

properties.name: sort
properties.doc: TODO: a list of Scenario^ attributes to sort on. If False, do not allow sort.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc:
The scenario to display and edit.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: expandable
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario viewer can be expanded.
If False, the scenario viewer is not expandable and it is shown depending on expanded value.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, when a valid scenario is selected, the scenario viewer is expanded and its content is displayed.
If False, the scenario viewer is collapsed and only its name and submit button are visible.

properties.name: show_submit
properties.doc: If False, the scenario submit button is not visible.

properties.name: show_delete
properties.doc: If False, the button to delete a scenario is not visible.

properties.name: show_config
properties.doc: If False, the scenario configuration label is not visible.

properties.name: show_creation_date
properties.doc: If False, the scenario creation date is not visible.

properties.name: show_cycle
properties.doc: If False, the scenario cycle label is not visible.

properties.name: show_tags
properties.doc: If False, the scenario tags are not visible.

properties.name: show_properties
properties.doc: If False, the scenario properties are not visible.

properties.name: show_sequences
properties.doc: If False, the scenario sequences are not visible.

properties.name: show_submit_sequences
properties.doc: If False, the buttons to submit scenario sequences are not visible.

properties.name: on_submission_change
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when a submission status is changed.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • submission (Submission): the submission entity containing submission information.
  • details (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • submission_status (str): the new status of the submission (possible values are: "SUBMITTED", "COMPLETED", "CANCELED", "FAILED", "BLOCKED", "WAITING", or "RUNNING").
    • job: the Job (if any) that is at the origin of the submission status change.
    • submittable_entity (Submittable): the entity (usually a Scenario) that was submitted.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc:
The Scenario^ whose diagram is displayed.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If False, this scenario's DAG is not displayed.

properties.name: show_toolbar
properties.doc: If False, the DAG toolbar is not visible.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the control.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The maximum width, in CSS units, of the control.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when a a node is selected.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • entity (DataNode | Task): the entity (DataNode or Task) that was selected.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected DataNode^(s), or None if there is none.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc: If False, the cycles are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc: If False, the primary scenarios are not identified with specific visual hint.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when a data node is selected.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (DataNode^): the selected data node.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the control.

properties.name: show_pins
properties.doc: If True, a pin is shown on each item of the selector and allows to restrict the number of displayed items.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc: TODO: If the Scenario^ is set, the selector will only show datanodes owned by this scenario.

properties.name: datanodes
properties.doc: TODO: The list of DataNode^/Scenario^/Cycle^ to show. Shows all Cycle/Scenario/DataNode if value is None.

properties.name: multiple
properties.doc: TODO: If True, the user can select multiple datanodes.

properties.name: filter
properties.doc: TODO: a list of DataNode^ attributes to filter on. If False, do not allow filter.

properties.name: show_search
properties.doc: TODO: If True, allows the user to search locally on label.

properties.name: sort
properties.doc: TODO: a list of DataNode^ attributes to sort on. If False, do not allow sort.

properties.name: data_node
properties.doc:
The data node to display and edit.
If the value is a list, it must have a single element otherwise nothing is shown.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: expandable
properties.doc:
If True, the data node viewer can be expanded.
If False, the data node viewer is not expandable and it is shown depending on expanded value.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, when a valid data node is selected, the data node viewer is expanded and its content is displayed.
If False, the data node viewer is collapsed and only its name is visible.

properties.name: show_config
properties.doc: If False, the data node configuration label is not visible.

properties.name: show_owner
properties.doc: If False, the data node owner label is not visible.

properties.name: show_edit_date
properties.doc: If False, the data node edition date is not visible.

properties.name: show_expiration_date
properties.doc: If False, the data node expiration date is not visible.

properties.name: show_properties
properties.doc: If False, the data node properties are not visible.

properties.name: show_history
properties.doc: If False, the data node history is not visible.

properties.name: show_data
properties.doc: If False, the data node value is not visible.

properties.name: show_owner_label
properties.doc: If True, the data node owner label is added to the datanode label at the top of the block.

properties.name: chart_config
properties.doc: Chart configs by data node configuration id.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc:
A variable bound to this property is set to the selected Scenario^ when the user picks it from the list of owner scenarios accessible from the 'Owner' field in the 'Properties' tab.
This property is set to None if there is no selected owner scenario.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected Job^(s), or None if there is none.

properties.name: show_id
properties.doc: If False, the Job^ id is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_submitted_label
properties.doc: If False, the Scenario^ or Sequence^ label is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_submitted_id
properties.doc: If True, the Scenario^ or Sequence^ id is shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_submission_id
properties.doc: If True, the submission id is shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_date
properties.doc: If False, the Job^ date is not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_cancel
properties.doc: If False, the Cancel buttons are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: show_delete
properties.doc: If False, the Delete buttons are not shown in the selector.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
A function or the name of a function that is triggered when the selection is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (Job^): the selected job.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of the control.

properties.name: on_details
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the details icon is pressed.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the id of the control.
  • payload (dict): a dictionary that contains the Job Id in the value for key args.

If False, the icon is not shown.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: The identifier that will be assigned to the rendered HTML component.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc:
The list of CSS class names associated with the generated HTML Element.
These class names will be added to the default taipy_gui_core-<element_type>.
